result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald A. Ross Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: TC from Ronnie Ross Jr requesting additional time for his furlough - it was explained to him that the Judge was unavailable and that he would need to report back to jail at the previously designated time.

3:12 pm Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend To misdemeanor bail jumping - PTAC - violation of 946.49(1)(a) - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea. Bednar/Bennett/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence

Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

2:34 p.m. Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states that he is represented by Brian Bennett and was told by Bennett his adjourned initial appearance has been continued until December 4, 2015.  Bail continued. Adj. 2:36 p.m.
Preliminary hearing at 12-04-2015 11:30 am
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-09-2015 02:30 pm

Attorney Bennett will be representing Mr. Ross.  He is unavailable for Monday.  The time limits will be waived as he is sitting a sentence on other charges.  Set a preliminary hearing for 12/4/15 15 11:30.
No contact WHATSOEVER with Richard Nitschke, Debra Healy, Andrea Healy, Cassidy Weinstein, and JW including 3rd party contact.

1:55 p.m. Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court, via video, with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Ronald A. Ross in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan special appearance - defendant is eligible for PD and will be appointed PD. Hogan raises for appeal purposes that she believes that there is no probable cause in complaint. Schiek/Defendant statement to bail. Court sets $5000 sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
